snippet: A look at the life of Eva Tanguay, a poem by young poets that celebrates New York City and a handbook about government in the Empire State.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books Queen of Vaudeville: The Story of Eva Tanguay by Andrew L Erdman, A Poem as Big as New York City, a collection of works by young poets edited by the Teachers & Writers Collaborative, and The Oxford Handbook of New York State Government, edited by Gerald Benjamin.
lead_paragraph: A look at the life of Eva Tanguay, a poem by young poets that celebrates New York City and a handbook about government in the Empire State.

headline.seo: Books About New York, Eva Tanguay and State Government
headline.main: A Queen, a Poem and a Handbook, All Big
headline.print_headline: A Queen, a Poem and a Handbook, All Big
